On 11/12/05, itsmebas <Bas@...> wrote:
>
> BTW: I had set the co=
efficients for excess genes, disjoint genes and
> weight difference to 1, 1=
, and 2, respectively. Mutation rates are set
> such that I get neural netw=
orks with a complexity of 100 to 200 after
> 500 generations (starting with=
 22 inputs, 3 outputs and one connection).

I just wanted to point out, sin=
ce Bas is using ANJI, that the mutation
rates in ANJI work quite differentl=
y than they do in the original NEAT
implementation.  There's a previous dis=
cussion of this in the archives
I believe, so I won't go into it, but the b=
asic result is that ANJI's
mutation rates add a lot more topology per gener=
ation than Ken's.

If you want to implement the mutation rates the way Ken =
did, just set
the parameter:

topology.mutation.classic

to TRUE.  This may=
 have been part of the difficulty in tuning
speciation as well.  Don't know=
, but I thought I'd mention
it...although now it sounds like you've got mos=
t of your issues with
speciation worked out.

Derek
